title: More than Game Music: Making Warsongs

replies.body: @Riot - You should make an in game client that will let us create a soundtrack to our adventures, and add these to the in game music.
sounds like something a 3rd party app would add on
maybe, but it needs to have in game menu functions for selecting playlist and skipping tracks.

I feel as though your previous comment was well enough, but with your new statement it provokes the thought of "Why not just put on an internet radio station, or listen to an album you have at home?"

I imagine that a toggle in the settings interface, that you could choose a preferred genre of music to have in game, or in champion select, would suffice (not to say this idea is the only thing I want from LoL or to sound like a needy ass hole, I'm just responding to ideas with ideas) many peoples wants from the music. For instance, I would toggle on metal music from Riot Records for my game play, and a good friend of mine would probably choose the EDM or whatever it's called. (Dubstep? I digress.) 

Well, here's my input on such things. 

- HA HA! 
Master Macro
if you play {{champion:17}} , you must listen to where the hood at by dmx, on repeat until you win a game

The thing is ,Riot has a bunch of music that gets us pumped up and is tied to league, tied to worlds, tied to xpeke backdoors, champion reveals and tons of epic league events. This stuff should be in the client. Secondly, its not too demanding on the pc but you still have to have a second application running, which splits your resources, and adds volume control complications. The client is already playing music, the resources are already in use. Just put more music files and let us control which ones play.
Try overwolf. It has an app called 8Tracks, you can select and switch your music without even minimizing the league client, in game our out. It's free :)

Logged in just to upvote. They should indeed do this with the Pentakill album and the other albums they made. But as others said, not the Sona music of course. What advantage would we get for having the skin if we could just listen to it everytime.

Too many copyright issues if it's to add any music, what they could do though is create a playlist menu option that includes all music produced by Riot, where you can pick however many you like and those get added randomly to the in game music rotation.
no they wont get any copy right problems because they aint claiming the song as their own and the songs we can play or riot lets us listen too it would be only to listin to as an audio track

You don't have to claim a song as your own to be infringing copyright. Just the simple use of the song without permission would be copyright infringement. I'd also like to mention that _all_ songs are "audio tracks."

Id be fine with that. there is a lot of amazing music riot has the rights to, this new playlist for example, the sona tracks, and any other music theyve done for champ load screens...it would be refreshing.
I agree with all the songs they've made and loading screen songs, but not the Sona tracks. It would kinda make having the skin in game kinda pointless.
riot should let us add our own soundtracks so it could make our game more interesting and to add a button to let which teamate listen in like the mute mute button...
Thats a pretty good way to lose elo lol, I dont think there could be any way to implement that without people being distracted from the game.
Knowing that riot has released a soundtrack to fit the mood of intense ranked matches...it fills you with determination.
I logged in just to upvote this. Undertale ftw!

The back-foundation music creates throughout the world and in games and other media is often forgotten or overlooked but, its effects as the starting point of feeling and emotions for a user are astronomical. You all at Riot Records do a amazing job with your music, and in a surprisingly short amount of time. As someone who used to be a musician I hope project like these keep happening and you seek to fulfill them to the best you can. Cheers!

All the music done by Riot is fantastic. Whoever makes all this happen is doing an awesome job. I'm a very critical musician but am constantly impressed by Riot's music--especially the login screens. Kindred's was A+. Keep up the good work!
